Transcription-Unit.comment:
Under nitrogen-rich growth conditions, the expression of the glnE gene was increased in mutants for two transcriptional regulators, Fnr and Fur. However, under nitrogen-limited growth conditions, the gene expression was decreased. It is unknown if the effects of the transcriptional regulators act directly on the gene expression [Kumar11].

A potential RNA G-quadruplex structure, formed by guanine-rich sequences located in the coding sequence region of the gene, was identified for ygiF and glnE . This structure could regulate the expression of the genes, as observed for hemL gene expression [Shao20].

Publication.title: The genes of the glutamine synthetase adenylylation cascade are not regulated by nitrogen in Escherichia coli.
Publication.author: van Heeswijk WC
Rabenberg M
Westerhoff HV
Kahn D

Evidence-Code.comment: Automated inference. A computer inferred this assertion through one of many possible methods such as sequence similarity, recognized motifs or consensus sequence, etc. When a person made the inference from computational evidence, use EV-COMP-HINF.
The length of the (transcribed) RNA is experimentally determined. The length of the mRNA is compared with that of the DNA sequence and by this means the number of genes transcribed are established.
